scripts.//: ugc and dev are distinct because you may frequently wish to restart `dev`, whereas `ugc` rarely changes
scripts.ugc: concurrently -p "[{name}]" -n "app-ugc,hub-ugc" -c "bgBlue.bold,bgMagenta.bold" "pnpm --filter app-ugc build && pnpm --filter app-ugc serve" "pnpm --filter hub-ugc build && pnpm --filter hub-ugc serve"
scripts.dev: concurrently -p "[{name}]" -n "app,hub,cwa,peer" -c "bgBlue.bold,bgMagenta.bold,bgGreen.bold,bgWhiteBright.bold" "pnpm --filter app dev" "pnpm --filter hub dev" "pnpm --filter cwa dev" "pnpm --filter peer dev"
scripts.build: concurrently -p "[{name}]" -n "app,hub,app-ugc,hub-ugc,cwa" -c "bgBlue.bold,bgMagenta.bold,bgGreen.bold,bgYellow.bold,bgBlackBright.bold" "pnpm --filter app build" "pnpm --filter hub build" "pnpm --filter app-ugc build" "pnpm --filter hub-ugc build" "pnpm --filter cwa build"
scripts.deploy: concurrently -p "[{name}]" -n "app,hub,app-ugc,hub-ugc,cwa" -c "bgBlue.bold,bgMagenta.bold,bgGreen.bold,bgYellow.bold,bgBlackBright.bold" "pnpm --filter app run deploy" "pnpm --filter hub run deploy" "pnpm --filter app-ugc run deploy" "pnpm --filter hub-ugc run deploy" "pnpm --filter cwa run deploy"
